etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Trilobites, from Greek tri- ‘three’ + lobos ‘lobe’

definitions: an extinct marine arthropod that occurred abundantly during the Paleozoic era, with a carapace over the forepart, and a segmented hind part divided longitudinally into three lobes.

notes.text: Subphylum Trilobita, phylum Arthropoda: numerous classes and orders

shortDefinitions: fossil marine arthropod that occurred abundantly during Palaeozoic era, with carapace over forepart
